As an AI language model, I am not a medical professional, so please keep in mind that the following recommendations are not medical advice. However, here are some additional tips that may help manage pain in the moment:

1. Try heat therapy: Applying heat to the affected area, such as with a heating pad or warm towel, can help relax muscles and reduce pain. 2. Use cold therapy: Applying a cold compress or ice pack to the affected area can help reduce inflammation and numb the pain. 3. Massage: Gently massaging the affected area can help stimulate blood flow and reduce muscle tension, which in turn can help alleviate pain. 4. Mind-body techniques: Activities such as yoga, tai chi, or meditation can help promote relaxation and reduce physical and emotional stress, which can help alleviate pain. 5. Over-the-counter pain relievers: For mild to moderate pain, over-the-counter pain relievers such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) like ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin) or aspirin may be effective. It is important to follow the recommended dosages and talk to your healthcare provider if you have any concerns. Note that if the pain is severe or persistent, it is important to speak with a healthcare provider.
